text.p: Here are highlights of stories in Romania's press on Wednesday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy:
Business:
ROMANIA LIBERA
- Tractorul UTB tractor maker in Brasov to raise tractor prices by an average 25 percent.
- Romania's farming sector affected by diesel oil shortage.
ADEVARUL
- Price of sunflower oil to rise by 25 percent.
- Senate approved law on banks' privatisation.
CURIERUL NATIONAL
- Prices for petrol and diesel oil to remain unchanged till December.
ZIUA
- RWE Entsorgung of Germany eyes joint venture with Bucharest city-hall in new garbage damp project.
- Turnover at Bucharest bourse on the slide.
LIBERTATEA
- Italian and german companies to cooperate with Bucharest city-hall in major project to clean the city.
General:
ROMANIA LIBERA

- Present form of Romanian-Hungarian friendship treaty will be a constant source for tensions between the two states, capable of leading to huge inter-ethnic clashes in Romania, said Ioan Gavra, vice-president of National Unity Party (PUNR).
- Newspaper publishes remarks by politicians from almost whole political spectrum on split of governing coalition after ruling Party of Social Democracy (PDSR) canceled a protocol with PUNR.
- Health ministry says 17 people died and 303 were hospitalised so far in Romania's worst meningitis epidemic over the past 10 years.
ADEVARUL
- Newspaper presents new agriculture, justice and communications ministers appointed after former PUNR members were sacked.
- Government sacked five local prefects and four deputy prefects, all PUNR members, following the brake of the PDSR-PUNR governing protocol.
- Government adopted decision to finance political parties from the state budget with 4.5 billion lei, the equivalent of 0.04 percent of the GDP.
- Independent senator resigned saying he was displeased with the low wage and pension he got as an MP.
EVENIMENTUL ZILEI

- From December 1991 (when constitution was adopted) to October 1992 (when President Iliescu was elected) is not a "presidential mandate but a period of transition" said ruling PDSR in response to allegations that Iliescu's candidacy for November 3 presidential polls would be a third and therefore an unconstitutional mandate.
- Romania has only 9,000 purebreed horses.
- Miners' trade union confederation will back opposition Social Democratic Union (USD) and its presidential candidate former reformist premier Petre Roman in the November 3 polls.
- Newspaper publishes programme of Adrian Paunescu, presidential candidate of Socialist Labour Party (PSM) in the November 3 presidential elections.
CURIERUL NATIONAL
- President Iliescu said he would promote a center, Western kind electoral platform for the November 3 polls.
LIBERTATEA
- Declaration of dignitaries' assets could turn into benefit for the theves, said MPs debating the bill asking for the declaration to be confidential.
COTIDIANUL

- What was before (the constitution) does not count, the constitution is the starting point, says President Iliescu about his new candidacy for the November 3 polls, but former Justice minister Teofil Pop says Iliescu had already two constitutional mandates, a new one being in breach of the law.
CRONICA ROMANA
- Opposition Democratic Convention (CDR) prepares a huge electoral fraud as it seems to have done in the local elections too, said PDSR president Oliviu Gherman.
DIMINEATA

- Newspaper publishes report by governmental control bodies and justice ministry on measures taken to fight economic and financial crimes in the first half of 1996 and measures to stop corruption. ($=3,164 lei) -- Bucharest Newsroom 40-1 3120264
